member.name: T:ILCalc.CalcContext
member.summary:
Represents the expression context (arguments, constants and functions available to use in expression, parsing settings) and provides methods to compile, evaluate and validate expressions in runtime.
This class cannot be inherited.

member.name: T:ILCalc.InvalidRangeException
member.summary:
The exception that is thrown when the instance validation is failed.
This class cannot be inherited.

member.name: M:ILCalc.InvalidRangeException.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: M:ILCalc.InvalidRangeException.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with a specified error message.
member.param: The message that describes the error.

member.name: M:ILCalc.InvalidRangeException.#ctor(System.String,System.Exception)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with a specified error message and a reference to the inner exception that is the cause of this exception.
member.param: The message that describes the error.
The exception that is the cause of the current exception, or a null reference if no inner exception is specified.

member.name: T:ILCalc.OptimizeModes
member.summary: Provides enumerated values to use to set expression optimizer options. Expression optimizer will be used by when creating , or objects.

member.name: F:ILCalc.OptimizeModes.None
member.summary: Specifies that no optimizations are should be done.

member.name: F:ILCalc.OptimizeModes.ConstantFolding
member.summary: Constant folding optimization should be done for the expression. It is used to perform partical evaluation of operators in parse-time when operands are known values: 2 + 8 / 4 will be replaced by 4.

member.name: F:ILCalc.OptimizeModes.FunctionFolding
member.summary:
Function folding optimization should be done for the expression. It is used for invoking function in parse-time when all the arguments of function are known values: sin(pi / 6) will be replaced with 0.5.
WARNING: Functions should not produce any side-effects or you may get an unexpected result.

member.name: F:ILCalc.OptimizeModes.PowOptimize
member.summary: Power operator optimization should be done for the expression. It is used for replacing expressions like x ^ 4 with x * x * x * x that evaluates much faster.

member.name: F:ILCalc.OptimizeModes.PerformAll
member.summary: Specifies that all of optimizations are should be done.
